intro: Maytenus disticha, commonly known as the two-branched mayten, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers followed by orange to red berries that are an important food source for various birds and mammals. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of soil types and light conditions.
